title: Everything You Need to Know About IEM San Jose 2015
body: The offseason is long and fraught with roster swaps, retirements, and re-signings -- not to be confused with resignings, which are also a fact of offseason life. After having our share of popcorn and speculation, there's the Season X IEM San Jose tournament to sate our appetite for professional League. November 21-22, six teams from four major regions will meet at the SAP Center in San Jose, California.

replies.body: Man that TBA guy is one hell of a player.  Playing for CLG as ADC then every lane for UOL...

I don't know why everyone is dissing certain TSM. They have a completely new lineup minus Bjergsen. The only reason why anyone should have a legitimate reason to hate on TSM is if they do not like Bjergsen personally. People are getting upset about how bad TSM is when there is only one member from last split on the team still. Also C9 isn't in because not enough fans voted for them. Fans voted on what team they wanted to see, and unfortunately for some people it may not be the team that they wish. In all honesty it doesn't matter because these players are far better than a great amount of us i mean maybe one or two people that are commenting are anywhere near the rank of them, others (like me) are low elo players that are voicing our opinions.  So no need to get upset about what teams are in because it comes down to the general public and everyones' choice when they had the chance.

I'm fine with TSM being in the tournament even though I'm a C9 fan, although obviously I'd prefer it if C9 had gotten the vote. But also the only legitimate reason to hate on TSM isn't just if you don't like Bjergsen, for instance, I really don't like TSM because I don't like Reginald. I mean, with this new lineup especially, if he were to sell TSM to someone else and completely wash his hands of the brand, I would probably like TSM.
Without Regi Jack wouldn't have bought and created C9. Jack and Regi are good friends from Jack being a part of TSM.  Does this mean you don't like Jack now and if so are you not a C9 fan anymore?
yeah, ummm, that would be extremely faulty reasoning, people i like can be friends with people i don't like, that doesn't make me not like the second person magically

> China's LGD Gaming was given an opportunity to wash out the sour taste of their disappointing Worlds performance by winning their fan vote.

Why does this feel like a low blow to me? I'm not an LGD fan but it seemed kinda harsh or maybe I'm misinterpreting it ?

Slightly off point, but I do get sick of this whole LGD massivly under-performing and the like. Basically taking any credit away from Origan and KT. Yes LGD are a lineup of stars, but from my view, that was it. There didn't seem to have any world class team coordination at all.
It will be refreshing to see them again without the pressure on their shoulders, so hopefully they play their own comfortable way this time. (Jin Air for win BTW ;) )
Can't say I blame them for playing on 5.21, I feel like I'd do the same about now.
RIP FNC. I hope whoever is sick gets better.
Why do the EU teams get byes?

Don't insult the hours and efforts of those organizing the event. 
They are not idiots and so recognized that UoL will not inherit the seed from FNC and will be updating a new draw tomorrow.

why have them play on 5.21? one of the biggest reasons to watch pro games is to adapt game play into your own game.
it would have been much much more interesting to see them battle it out on 5.22
kinda disappointing TBH...

Good to see Jin Air on the international stage!! :)
Very interested to see how this new TSM will go too, cause thats an insane lineup!
played on 5.21? whats the point in watching this?

Would be nice if they would actually play on the preseason patch...kind of set a little of the tone for the upcoming season.  Playing  the old season for a seemingly just for fun tourny seems a bit pointless...
All the salty c9 fans :3. Really though guys, none of the teams are the same anyway. Everyone hating on TSM; they have 1 member still the same.
Wondering what got Jin air the bye to the semis maybe because Korea won worlds? I'm not sure just an interesting choice
Jin Air is awful comparative, they either bought their way into the tournament (sponsor paid) or...well...other teams are busy with press? Idfk.

Have you ever watched 1 game of Jin Air in LDK?  If you have no idea what you're talking about, you should stfu.  Jin Air often beats SKT and Koo tigers in league plays.  I'd be surprised if any other team could get one game off of them.
Jin Air in LCK was part of the middle pick of teams that as one castor (I think monte) perfectly described "were almost good-tier teams."
You guys messed up the times for the schedule, all of the 11am games are labeled pm.
First the All-Stars ticket sale date and now this... Rito really needs to stop making their interns write these posts.
NA is dead in the IEM {{item:3070}}
Really NA? I can understand Clg cause they won NA Lcs but Tsm? They are really underperforming this split.Tbh I'd rather have Tip and Clg represent NA tho I'd prefer C9 and Clg
This split??
tilted since MSI.

We all smart people know that this kind of shity tournamets never count lol.. haha wheres EDG SKT and KOO why they invite the last place on KR server XD lmao this will be just filled of adversiting because is not real LoL tournament but a planned one with Plastic trophy who ever wins this crappy tournament will never count . just like previous IEM.  and the guys that got so many down votes were from many boronze 5 brainless Butthurt  fa.gs  Stay Salty FRESSM

lolol dude you're the one being salty , teams are voted by fans so know that before you comment. And the rule is the world champions shouldn't participate in IEM san jose , that's why even they are voted as 1 , they couldn't participate so jin air the second highest voted takes place. and skt are given a spot in IEM Katowice. so use your brain , read all the rules and then comment , ok cupcakielover? and oh get to level 30 first before making these stupid comments in boards ok?
What...? Have you been following the esports scene lately??
Interested to see how this will play out. Honestly just a way to test the waters with new rosters for most teams
Can somebody tell me how they determined which teams get byes? Does anyone know?
I suppose EU and KR got byes due to their performances at Worlds.
NA vs Korea and China, meanwhile BOTH EU teams get byes? WTF??!!! They should have at least given the byes to the teams with the highest votes!

They gave byes based on who performed how well at Worlds (the most recent tournament with all regions present). Since, FNC is not showing up, they will in fact update draws tomorrow with new seeding although OG should still have a bye.
Wait, why the heck is PowerOfEvil in for Origen as their midlander? What happened to xPeke?
QUE PASO CON XPEKE NO JUGARA MAS EN OG O ES SOLO POR ESTE EVENTO SU AUSENCIA
gosu adc for clg?

I like how some NA fanboys were crying why are EU geting bye's when it's obvious that the two strongest teams among those were the two EU teams and their performance at worlds(semif) warrants them the highest seeds. Also you are crying that NA is having to face strong opposition while EU gets bye, are you ok? One of the EU teams is going 1st. replacing our strongest team(UoL - FNC) and 2nd a team that hasn't even announced their squad. TSM are going to play their first official game with their squad too but UoL wouldn't even had enough time to train with their new squad. They were supposed to get new squad till next split now they had to do emergency search. Theya re a dead card in this tournament. And since they probably won't get a bye it's already 1 EU team less.(CLG or LGD are probably getting the bye, if Worlds performance matters) So stop whining and see how your teams will do. CH and KR again have pretty weak teams so the trophy might go west. It really is up to weather TSM are good again or Origen will take it imho.

WHOA WHOA. You mean those two semifinal teams that never legit faced a korean team? You mean those two eu teams that got 0-3 at worlds .You mean that fnatic team with 3 asians that got humiliated by the 3rd place seed in Korea when every eu fanboy expected the opposite score? LMFAO

At least, both EU teams made it to semifinals. Did a single NA team EVER did it ?
Btw, Yellowstar is french.
Yes they did. Season 1 had TSM come in 3rd and EPik Gamer 4th. So 2 semi-finals NA teams right there.

(Can't reply to the good comment)
I just don't understand why you think I will insult you. Yes, I disagree with you, but I will never insult you, as I never did. Doesn't make sense.

I'm talking about your logic, saying EU has nothing to be proud of for the past 2 years. Then, considering EU performance these years, I conclude NA has nothing to be proud of at all.
I don't understand why you say NA did great in season 1. Yes, they had  strong performance in the groups (that's only 3 games), but then, their only achievement is like beating the Wildcards teams, one EU team and fighting each other for the third place and in the Loser Bracket. Forgive me, but that's not something really glorious. Season 4 is, for sure, the best NA showing, but I only account TSM exceptional showing, because, as you said, they took one game off the best 2 teams. Cloud 9 achievements (beating SSB) was also achieved by Fnatic, though they had no credit for that.
In Season 2, only TSM got cheated. The other teams just failed. And Riot said in their statement they would not change the output of the match because AZF was still more dominant than TSM.

You also keep ignoring things. Season 1 was NOT a good showing for NA. Am I ignoring EU failures ? I mentioned the 2014 throw in my previous post. Yes, Fnatic was eliminated because of 10 Nexus HP. Yes, Alliance completely fucked up, and I'm glad they paid the high price for being so disrespectful towards KaBum. Yes, I admit the failures. But you don't. You talk about KaBum. Interesting. Let's talk about paiN, then. The brazilian team TIED with CLG, NA #1 Seed. Let's talk about NA 0-10. Let's talk about season 2 and 3 where no NA team made it out of groups. Let's talk about the remaining team still being defeated.

Flash Wolves defeated KOO twice. It's not worth nothing. But yet, I agree, it was the easiest opponent. But you just skip EDG 3-0 like it was nothing.

You know, I'm just tired of EU bashing. Because NA fans keep on trashtalking EU like they are the best region, whereas it's not. Dude, how can anyone can mock EU 0-6 defeats in the Semifinals whereas no NA team got ouf of groups with a 0-10 performance ? I'm tired of the shoutcasters mocking their performance with a prayer whereas nothing similar has been done for the NA throw. I'm tired of NA taking the littlest fact and turn it against EU whereas they keep on sweeping out their fails and mistakes. I'm tired to see "EU is trash" whereas TSM is more a danish team than an american one. I'm tired to read "EU only works with KR imports" whereas almost all NA teams have koreans in their ranks (and in a few rosters, NA players are in the minority).
Let me be clear. I am not saying you said this. But I'm just sad that NA fans minimize their throws (nobody talks about the fact that CLG is TIED with paiN) and focus on every single EU mistake. Dude, how can you say it's a throw not making it to the Finals ?

Yeah, I shit on NA just as you shit on EU. Because you don't recognize NA throws as well. You can call me a brick wall if you want, but you're doing just like me

Finally, as I said, I won't insult you and I don't know why you think I could do such a thing. Even tho we have complete opposite opinions, I still respect you.

I'm tired of the shoutcasters mocking their performance with a prayer whereas nothing similar has been done for the NA throw. I'm tired of NA taking the littlest fact and turn it against EU whereas they keep on sweeping out their fails and mistakes. I'm tired to see "EU is trash" whereas TSM is more a danish team than an american one. I'm tired to read "EU only works with KR imports" whereas almost all NA teams have koreans in their ranks (and in a few rosters, NA players are in the minority).

It appears that we were having a mutual misunderstanding and were both coming from the same place. Being sick and tied of NA?EU fans just shitting on our region. I guess we're so used to the other side doing that we were coming from the position of the other meaning worse than they did. Luckily no actual name calling or rudeness came from this misunderstanding.

It's refreshing talking to an open-minded person. Looking back on your comments with this information I see where you're coming from. Sorry for my part. Now if you'll excuse me I need to watch IEM San Jose. Group D reunion! :D

> [{quoted}](name=SpookyPowa,realm=EUW,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=PBEuEUgH,comment-id=00090003000000010001,timestamp=2015-11-21T11:07:08.863+0000)
>
> @TrollFan01 : It was in the _Loser_ bracket, and they faced Epik, a NA team too, so it doesn't make sense.
> So NA has nothing to be proud of for every single World Championship. And I think you missunderstood me. Season 1 was a particular context, as there was only NA and EU teams (and two minor teams, including one that still won a game against TSM). No korean and no chinese teams, only 6 teams in the Bracket. And even in this context, NA still didn't make it to the Finals.
> So, Season 1 apart, two EU teams made it to the Semifinals, except in 2014. And no NA team ever did that. Am I right ?

Doesn't make sense but still counts. Pretty much sums up Season 1 in a nutshell huh?

LOL! What are you talking about? NA did GREAT in Season 1 and 4. TSM beat the 2 best teams in the world last year and were the pride and joy of NA along with Cloud9. Season 3 and 5 were the only times NA weren't proud. Season 2 we got cheated by Woong looking at the map and it caused all kinds of controversy and it cost him and is team $30,000.

If you keep moving the goalpost anything will fit what you want it to. You keep doing that and ignoring things. You said since Season 1 was EU vs EU that NA had nothing to be proud of and then don't even mention what I said about that logic meaning EU has nothing to be proud of since it was Korea vs Korea this year. You completely disregard Season one groups since NA topped them and then bring of Team Xan and that one -off win it had against TSM but fail to bring up that TSM still topped the group. You sing the praise of EU but never bring up their failures. You skip over Season 4 like it's nothing because NA did great and EU sucked. You say NA has nothing to be proud of when you're given proof they do from Season 1 and Season 4 showings. You only bring up level of competition (Team Xan) when it goes against NA but not EU. The Flash Wolves were one of the teams any team would have beaten this year in Quarters. Kabum E sports were a thing. ALL will tell you.

You're speaking nonsense and you move the goalpost whenever a fact s given to you that goes against what you want. You're never going to acknowledge that NA has done well at worlds even worth the proof of Season 1 and Season 4 staring back at you. There's no point further talking to you. You're just going to shit on NA and sing EU's praises. You'ere just going to explain away all the good NA has done at worlds even if it makes EU look bad and sing the praises of EU even if it makes NA look good. There's no point in continuing this as I've made my points and you keep moving the goalpost. You'll probably insult me or say something else but I don't care. I'm speaking to a brick wall who won't budge even when given facts. Go ahead and insult me all you want. I don't care care. It won't mean anything.
Nobody gets a bye at Worlds.  Shouldn't happen at IEM either.
In past Worlds, half of the Final Bracket was fulfilled by team that got byes.
TSM FOR THE WIN!
Why the fuck is Jin Air representing Korea. 아나 미친놈들 한국을 좆으로 보네.
